instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
i have this board with this values
PPBUS_G3H=0
PP5V_S5=0
PP3V3_S5=0
PP3V3_S40=0
PP3V3_SUS=0
PP3V3_S3=0
PP3V42_G3H=3.4
I have P5V1_BIAS in short

advice?

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
"I have P5V1_BIAS in short"
Exact ohm value?
Compare with the values on C7100/1.

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message: veleus are same 0.12

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
You've said to have short at pin 5V1_BIAS.
R7191 is burnt?

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message: aesthetically it doesn't look burnt

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
So, do you have short there???
Already asked that, didn't get any reply...

Post U7100 basic voltages; pins 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
i have short in r7191
u7100
pin 1=0v
pin 2 = 0.2v
pin 3 =0.2
pin 9=0v
pin 12=3.4
pin 13=3.3
pin 14=0
pin 15=0.1
pin 17=0
pin 19=4.8
pin 20=5.3
pin 27=0
u7100 is very hot

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
Post U7100 diode mode to ground now; pins 2, 12, 17, 19, 20, 27.

"i have short in r7191"
Which pad to ground?

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
R7191 goes to pin 20 of U7100.
How don't you get ground there too??
However, 0.063 is not good; change U7100.
Check in diode mode again, once U7100 is removed (before resolder it).

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
i replaced u7100, now i have orange led and i no longer have short on R7191
but it still won't turn on

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
R7191 is still good, not blown?

Do you get 3V3_S5/SUS?

threads.message:
P3V3SUS_EN=0
3V3_S5=0.5
the coil looks perfect

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
Are you sure no voltage at L7560?
Check diode mode to ground there.

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
L7569=3.3V
in diode mode 0.147

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
I suppose you've meant L7560.

"3V3_S5=0.5"
What's this then???
PLEASE, post accurate information.

I ask again, do you have 3V3_SUS?
3V3_S5 seems to be OK.

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
What happened from yesterday?
"P3V3SUS_EN=0
3V3_S5=0.5"

Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L (at same time).

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message: PM_PWRBTN_L= from3.4v at 0.420v

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
Check if PM_SLP_S4_L pulses at same time.
If yes, also check for pulse on al all big coils.

threads.title: 820-4924-a no power
threads.message:
PM_SLP_S4_L=0
now I no longer have any orange light and the bench power supply shows me 0.05
